tit.e: Godai Myoo, the Five Great Myoo
Godai Myoo, the Five Great Myoo

sen.j: 五大明王（ごだいみょうおう）は、仏教における信仰対象であり、密教特有の尊格である明王のうち、中心的役割を担う5名の明王を組み合わせたものである。
sen.e: Godai Myoo, Five Great Myoo is a subject of faith in Buddhism and a combination of five Myoo which play a central role among Myoo, a honorific entity, which is specific in Mikkyo, Esoteric Buddhism.
sen.cmt: 仏教→英辞郎 on the WEB、密教→http://www.koyasan.or.jp/english/shingonshu/mikkyo.html
sen.e: Godai Myoo (the five great myoo) is a subject of faith in Buddhism and a combination of the five Myoo, which play a central role among Myoo, an honorific entity, which is specific to Mikkyo Esoteric Buddhism.

Godai Myoo (the five great Myoo) is a subject of faith in Buddhism and a combination of the five Myoo, which play a central role among Myoo, an honorific entity, which is specific to Mikkyo Esoteric Buddhism.

sen.j: 本来は別個の尊格として起こった明王たちが、中心となる不動明王を元にして配置されたものである。
sen.e: Myoos, who were produced as independent honorific entities originally, are arranged around Fudo Myoo.

sen.j: 彫像、画像等では、不動明王が中心に位置し、東に降三世明王（ごうざんぜみょうおう）、南に軍荼利明王（ぐんだりみょうおう）、西に大威徳明王、北に金剛夜叉明王を配する場合が多い。
sen.e: In the images like statues and pictures, Fudo Myoo often is placed in the center, Gozanze Myoo at the east, Gundari Myoo at the south, Daiitoku Myoo at the west, and Kongoyasha Myoo at the north.

sen.j: なお、この配置は真言宗に伝承される密教（東密）のものであり、天台宗に伝承される密教（台密）においては金剛夜叉明王の代わりに烏枢沙摩明王が五大明王の一尊として数えられる。
sen.e: In addition, this arrangement is seen in Mikkyo (Tomitsu) which has been transmitted in Shingon sect, and in the other Mikkyo (Daimitsu) which has been transmitted in Tendai sect, Ususama Myoo is included in Godai Myoo instead of Kongoyasha Myoo.

sen.j: 五大明王像は日本において盛んに造像されたが、中国でも若干の遺例を見ることができる。
sen.e: The statues of Godai Myoo were made in Japan actively, while in China a few works were made.
Statues of the Godai Myoo were actively produced in Japan, while in China a few works were made.

sen.j: 日本では、密教が平安時代前期に隆盛したことから、五壇法の本尊として五大明王が祀られた。
sen.e: In Japan, Mikkyo was very popular during the first stage of Heian Period and Godai Myoo was enshrined as the principal image of Buddha of the ritual Godanho.

sen.j: 日本における代表的な造像例としては、京都の東寺講堂に安置されている平安時代前半の像（国宝）が知られる。
sen.e: As a representative statue of example in Japan, the statue, which was made in the first stage of Heian Period and is placed at auditorium of To-ji Temple, is known (national treasure).

sen.j: 五大明王に関する祭事では、京都醍醐寺が毎年2月に厳修する 五大力尊仁王会（ごだいりきそんにんのうえ）が有名。
sen.e: As to festival related to Godai Myoo, Godairikisonninnoue is famous, which Kyoto Daigo-ji Temple perform on February every year.
As for the festivals related to Godai Myoo, Godairikisonninnoue is famous, and Kyoto Daigo-ji Temple performs it in February of each year.

sen.j: 壮大な屋外大護摩「柴燈護摩」を焚き上げて五大明王の威力を讚えるこの祭事は、最終日に150キロもある超特大の鏡餅を持ち上げる力自慢大会が伝統行事として今に伝えられている。
sen.e: In this festival, the power of Godai Myoo is magnified by burning large rite 'Saito Goma' outside and on the last day, the contest of strength by holding up a big Kagami-mochi of 150kg has been held as a traditional event.
